entry.title: Nigerian Court Denies Binance's Tigran Gambaryan Bail amid Health Concerns
entry.summary: A Nigerian court has denied a bail application for Tigran Gambaryan, an executive at Binance Holdings Ltd., citing his trial on money laundering and currency manipulation allegations. The court ruled today (Friday) that Gambaryan's health condition did not justify his release. Justice Emeka Nwite of the Federal High Court in Abuja noted that illness alone does not warrant bail unless it poses a threat to others. Binance Executive's Health Concerns Gambaryan, who is the head of financial-crime compliance at Binance, has been in custody since February. His lawyer, Mark Mordi, argued that Gambaryan needs medical treatment for a herniated disk that has severely affected his mobility. Gambaryan appeared in court in a wheelchair. Following the ruling, Gambaryan’s wife, Yuki Gamb…

entry.title: ‘XRP Is Not A Security’: Bitnomial Files Lawsuit Against SEC
entry.summary:
Bitnomial Exchange, LLC has filed a lawsuit against the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and its commissioners on October 10, contesting the SEC’s claim that XRP is a security. The complaint, lodged in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois, seeks declaratory and injunctive relief against the federal regulator’s attempt to exercise jurisdiction over digital asset futures that Bitnomial argues should be regulated exclusively by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).
Bitnomial Sues SEC Over XRP Classification
Bitnomial, a designated contract market approved by the CFTC, has been in the spotlight after its plans to list XRP Futures were challenged by the SEC. According to the complaint, “The SEC asserts jurisdiction over a product that …

entry.title: Crypto Chaos: SEC Commissioner Uyeda Confesses Regulatory Failings
entry.summary:
The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has faced increasing criticism in recent years over its regulatory approach to the crypto industry under President Biden’s administration, characterized by increased enforcement actions and lawsuits against major players.
Commissioner Mark Uyeda recently voiced his concerns, describing the SEC’s strategy and regulation of the nascent crypto market as a “disaster for the entire industry” in an interview with FOX Business.
Uyeda Critiques SEC’s Enforcement-Driven Policies
Uyeda’s latest remarks reflect a growing discontent within the crypto ecosystem, particularly among stakeholders who advocate for a more balanced regulatory framework.
Along with fellow Commissioner Hester Peirce, dubbed the “crypto mom” for her consistent support …

entry.title: South Korea Is Looking To Lift Ban On Spot Crypto ETFs, Here’s Why
entry.summary:
South Korea’s top financial regulator, the Financial Services Commission (FSC), is reportedly initiating a review process to reconsider its stance on the ban on spot cryptocurrency exchange-traded funds (ETFs).
This comes after forming a new cryptocurrency advisory committee within the regulator, signaling a potential shift from its earlier, more stringent stance on digital asset exposure in traditional financial markets.
The committee is tasked with reevaluating current regulations that prevent listing spot crypto ETFs in the country.
Reason For The Review To Unban Crypto ETFs

entry.title: Bitcoin Stalls: Bullish Momentum Hinges On Reclaiming Key Metric, Expert Says
entry.summary:
Following Bitcoin’s price swings witnessed in the past weeks, a crypto expert has predicted a potential resurgence of bullish momentum in the short term. However, the crypto asset must recover a certain level in order to unlock the next significant price surge.
A Key Metric Could Kickstart Next Rally
Bitcoin continues to face notable setbacks, causing a lengthy period of consolidation, which has raised concerns about its path going forward. Nonetheless, there is hope once again as Kyle Doops, a market expert and trader has predicted that BTC could regain its upbeat momentum once it reclaims a key metric, particularly the Short-Term Holder (STH) MVRV metric.
The Short-Term Holder (STH) MVRV is the price of BTC divided by the realized price of short-term holders. Specifically, it is …

entry.summary: Kamala signals support for crypto. Top memecoins all soar, add $10bn in value in a week. MOODENG hits $180m, does 11x in a week. SUI & SEI continue to lead L1s for price & TVL growth. Revolut & Robinhood are considering stablecoin. Visa launches new tokenisation platform for banks. PayPal to allow business accounts to hold crypto Hamster kombat's HMSTER disappoints on launch. Biden admin may have forced Silvergate’s closure. Court rules crypto mining boxes ‘are securities’.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 206 - MEMES ARE PUMPING!
entry.summary: BTC nears $65k key resistance level. Kamala makes positive comments about crypto. PayPal allows businesses to hold crypto. Visa allows banks to test RWAs & smart contracts. Cuban wants to be head of SEC. Silvergate claims about ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ grow. Truflation hacked for $5m. Telegram Wallet blocked in UK & US. Court rules crypto mining boxes are securities. Infinex DeFi platform raises $65m. Ethena announces new stablecoin linked to BUIDL.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 205 - ALTCOINS CONTINUE TO RALLY!
entry.summary: SUI leads L1 gains as TVL crosses $1bn. Altcoin market cap close to breaking downtrend. SEI becomes top chain for 1 month TVL growth. ETH ETFs sees 3rd largest inflow ever. SEC delays ETH ETF options decision. SOL took most of ETH outflows over last 3 months. SOLETH continues to be trading at resistance. $8.1bn BTC options to expire this week. BTC heading to $500k-$1m in a year: PlanB. Stablecoin supply hits new ATH. Caroline Ellison sentenced to 2 years in jail. SBF & Diddy in the same jail. SEC settles against TUSD for not being collateralised. Gensler gets derided for crypto approach. Hester Pierce admits flaws in SEC crypto policy. Harris against regulation by litigation: Cuban. Golem claims ETH move to CEXs due to staking. Binance refutes data leak claims. Next Y combinator batch has ‘no crypto companies’. Celo overtakes Tron for stablecoin addresses.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 204 - MOODENG MOO-NING!
entry.summary: BTC needs to top $65.2k to put in a higher high. ETH ETFs see biggest outflow since July. ETH outperformance could be start of ‘alt season’. BlackRock gets 12hr BTC withdrawal from Coinbase. cbBTC only wrapped BTC to not show reserves. Telegram to share user data upon legal requests. EIGEN non-transferability to be removed Sep 30th. TIA announces $100m funding round. TIA deal was OTC token sale ‘done months ago’. Polymarket considers token, trying $50m raise. Maybe we will pay off debt with crypto: Trump. Harris unlikely to give full crypto policy pre-election. 13m Binance users’ data may have been leaked. Caroline Ellison likely won’t serve time in jail.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 203 - KAMALA GOES PRO-CRYPTO
entry.summary: Crypto funds saw $321m inflows last week. Kamala commits to crypto & AI expansion. TAO leads gains in AI hype, does 2x in 2 weeks. SUI TVL breaks $900m. Average Q4 returns for BTC is 88%. BTC Google searches down 75% since 2021. BTC 161 days from halving, when it rallied in 2020. Crypto VCs raised $2.2bn this year, well below 2021.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 202 - SOL STARTS TO SEND IT
entry.summary: SOL leads majors as Breakpoint begins. SOL launches Frankendancer on mainnet. Helio Pay allows Shopify items to sell on X. Franklin Templeton to launch fund on SOL. BTC short term holders fall at fastest rate in 12 years. MicroStrategy upsizes convertible note raise to $1bn. BingX loses $52m in hack. $243m crypto heist exposed by ZachXBT. Supreme Court of India hacked on X, shills scam. SocGen launches Euro stablecoin on SOL. Sky agrees to stop using WBTC. Germany shuts down 47 crypto exchanges. Stablecoin’s now 18th biggest holder of treasuries. Consensys lawsuit against SEC dismissed. Partisanship will stop Trump crypto plans: Hoskinson. Scaramucci working with Kamala on crypto.
